Pyongyang cultural exchange center established in Trinidad and Tobago
articles.content:
Pyongyang cultural exchange center established in Trinidad and Tobago 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang cultural exchange center was established in Trinidad and Tobago.
 The center based in the capital and local areas will exhibit and distribute DPRK books, photos and handicrafts on various occasions.    
 It was said at an inaugural ceremony on Nov. 14 that the center would organize lecture meetings, film shows, seminars and other functions to introduce and propagandize the greatness of Kim Jong Il, leader of the Korean people, the immortal Juche idea, the advantages of the Korean socialist system and the Korean people's efforts to build a powerful nation and reunify the country.

Anecdotes about Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Anecdotes about Kim Il Sung 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung gave field guidance to Iap-ri, Jungsan county, South Phyongan Province, in October Juche 43 (1954).He was informed that scores of the family members and relatives of the chairman of the management board there were killed by the enemy during the Korean War. The aide told the president repeatedly that it was high time to leave. The president told the aide to put off his itinerary and take a rest in the chairman's house today. Saying that he felt reluctant to leave, he proposed to spend the night with the chairman to alleviate his painful heart. He conversed with the chairman in an ordinary peasant house for hours and consoled him before leaving there for the next day's field guidance.
 One day in the autumn of Juche 51 (1962) the president found a shop no longer visible at a place in Pyongyang. In those days an institution was using it as a temporary office. Informed in detail of this, he told officials that an office could be shifted anywhere but the shop should remain there because its service was an urgent issue related to the people's living. The shop was thus reopened there.    
 He visited again Okpho-ri, Changsong county, North Phyongan Province, in the summer of a year and attentively saw a new pavilion built there. At that time a senior official told him that the people in the county built the pavilion so that he might have even a short rest on his ceaseless trip for field guidance. Asking the official why they did such a thing and what would happen if such a pavilion was built wherever he went, the president advised him to think of what should be done to enable the people to be well off, instead of doing such useless things. Then he instructed the official to remove the pavilion at once.

Message of solidarity to Palestinian President
articles.content:
Message of solidarity to Palestinian President
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of solidarity to Yasser Arafat, President of the state of Palestine, chairman of the executive committee of the PLO and head of the Palestinian national authority, on the occasion of the "world day of solidarity with the Palestinian people."
 The message extended firm solidarity to the president and people of Palestine on this occasion.    
 Today the Palestinian people are waging a dynamic struggle to put an end to Israel's occupation and achieve the national independence and liberation under the leadership of the PLO, the message said, wishing the president and people of Palestine greater success in their struggle to retake the legitimate national right.

articles.title: Greetings to Albanian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Albanian President
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Albanian President Rexhep Meidani on the occasion of its national day.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and, through him, to the government and people of the country on this occasion and sincerely wished the president success in his work for the country's prosperity and peace and stability in the Balkans.    
 It expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the new century.

articles.title: Greetings to Albanian foreign minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Albanian foreign minister
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, minister of foreign affairs of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to his Albanian counterpart Arta Dade on the occasion of its national day.
 In the belief that the ties between the two countries would continue to develop in the new century, the message wished the Albanian people prosperity and well-being.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets Chinese ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets Chinese ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly met and conversed with Wang Guozhang, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell visit to him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were vice-minister Kim Yong Il of foreign affairs, officials concerned and Tian Baozhen, minister-counselor of the Chinese embassy here, and other embassy officials.
